intro: Eleorchis conformis, commonly known as the slender orchid, is a terrestrial orchid species native to parts of Asia and Africa. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and grasslands. The plant features a slender stem with a single, narrow leaf and produces small, greenish-white flowers. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its simple, sympodial growth habit. Due to its habitat preferences, it is often found in areas with high humidity and well-drained soil.
